title: Good News! If You Missed Watching 'Tumbbad' In Theatres, It's Going To Be Screened Once Again!
text:
'Soja warna Hastar Aa Jaayega..', this line sent chills down the spine of many who gathered the courage to go to the theatres to watch Sohum Shah's Tumbbad last year. For all those who saw the film - it turned out to be a decision they'll not be regretting ever.

Many called the film a 'cinematic masterpiece' and the film got its due in many ways.

It managed to swipe all major technical awards at Indian award shows. The film was also running the race of being India's official entry for Oscars last year but Rima Das' Bulbul Can Sing made the cut. Nonetheless, the team was showered with lot of praises for the kind of experience the film offered the viewers.

The film is clocking its first anniversary and to make the day special, the movie is returning to the big screen on 12th October for a special screening. The screening will be attended by film’s cast crew and people from the industry.

Talking about Tumbbad, Sohum Shah, the main lead of the film said,

“Tumbbad will always remain a special film of my career, considering the overwhelming response it has received from all quarters. I’m happy to show the film to my industry friends and other fans who couldn’t watch the movie during its release and share the passion and excitement with them.”

Well, what are you waiting for? Book tickets of one of India's Hindi-language historical period horror films right away!
